info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 2:59PM MDT until August 26 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
At 259 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Though the heavy rain has moved out of the area, expect Flash flooding to be ongoing or will begin shortly as the the run off flows out of the area.
Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Sheep Creek, Dry Fork and Hay Gulch drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Rio Blanco County
info.instruction:
This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL RIO BLANCO COUNTY
